      • attributesToProperties

        public static Properties attributesToProperties(NamedNodeMap atts)
        Converts a set of XML DOM attributes into a standard Java Properties object where each property corresponds to an attribute.
        Parameters:
        atts - XML attributes to be converted. May be null.
        Returns:
        Properties corresponding to attributes. Never null but may be empty.

      • attributesMap

        Parameters:
        atts - XML attributes to be converted. May be null.
        Returns:
        Map corresponding to attributes. Never null but may be empty.

      • createObject

        public static Object createObject(Element element)
                           throws Exception
        Create an object from characteristics contained in an XML DOM Element.

        The DOM element should either be a Properties element or it should include an attribute called "class". That class should be on the CLASSPATH.

        If the element is a Properties element, a Java Properties object is created. Otherwise an instance of the class specified by the class attribute is created. That class will be instantiated using one of the following constructors:

        1. a constructor which takes a single DOM Node object as a parameter.
        2. a null constructor if the class has a setAttributes method which takes a single DOM Node object as a parameter.
        3. a null constructor if the class has a setAttributes method which takes a single Map object as a parameter.
        4. a constructor which takes a single Java Properties object as a parameter.
        If more than one constructor is present, the constructor to use is chosen in the above priority.

        The object passed to this method is used as the parameter to the Node constructor or setAttributes( Node ) method.

        The Map object passed to the setAttributes( Map ) method is created from the object passed to this method (see extractProperties(org.w3c.dom.Element)).

        The Properties object passed to the Properties constructor is created from the object passed to this method (see extractProperties(org.w3c.dom.Element)).

        In the cases where a Node object is used for configuration, we still process any nested Properties elements if the object has a setAttribute( String name, Object value ) method which can be called to set attributes from the nested Properties elements.

        Parameters:
        element - DOM XML element from which object will be created.
        Returns:
        The object created from the Element. Null if no class name attribute.
        Throws:
        Exception - If unable to create object.

      • extractProperties

        public static Properties extractProperties(Element element)
                                    throws Exception
        Extracts a Properties object from characteristics contained in an XML DOM Element.

        The properties come from the element itself if it is a Properties element otherwise the properties come from the attributes of the given element plus any child Properties element(s).

        A Properties element is defined by the DTD extract which appears below.

        If the same property appears in both an attribute as well as in a child property element, the property element value will take precedence. 

         !ELEMENT Properties ((Properties | Property)*)
    !ATTLIST Properties
              id          CDATA #IMPLIED
              refid       CDATA #IMPLIED
 
 
      !ELEMENT Property EMPTY
      !ATTLIST Property
                name      CDATA #REQUIRED
                value     CDATA #REQUIRED
        Parameters:
        element - XML element from which we want to extract Properties.
        Returns:
        corresponding properties
        Throws:
        Exception - if a reference to an unknown properties is encountered or if a Properties element contains some unknown child elements.

      • parse

        public static Document parse(InputStream xmlStream,
                             boolean validating,
                             boolean namespaceAware,
                             ILogger logger)
                      throws Exception
        Parse the given XML input stream into a DOM document.
        Parameters:
        xmlStream - XML stream to be processed.
        validating - True if the file should be validated and XML schemas are not being used. When schemas are used for validation rather than DTD files, this parameter should always be set false. Schema validation is performed separately using a javax.xml.validation.Validator instance.
        namespaceAware - True if support is provided for XML name spaces.
        logger - Logger used for reporting XML parsing problems. If null it uses its own logger.
        Returns:
        DOM Document resulting from parsing the stream.
        Throws:
        Exception - If fatal exceptions parsing stream.

      • parse

        public static Document parse(InputStream xmlStream,
                             boolean validating,
                             ILogger logger)
                      throws Exception
        Parse the given XML input stream into a DOM document - providing support for XML name spaces.
        Parameters:
        xmlStream - XML stream to be processed.
        validating - True if the file should be validated and XML schemas are not being used. When schemas are used for validation rather than DTD files, this parameter should always be set false. Schema validation is performed separately using a javax.xml.validation.Validator instance.
        logger - Logger used for reporting XML parsing problems. If null it uses its own logger.
        Returns:
        DOM Document resulting from parsing the file.
        Throws:
        Exception - If fatal exceptions parsing file.
        See Also:
        parse(InputStream, boolean, boolean, ILogger )

      • parse

        public static Element parse(String msg,
                            boolean validating,
                            boolean namespaceAware,
                            ILogger logger)
                     throws Exception
        Parse the XML in the given String into an Element.

        See parse( InputStream...) for description of other parameters.

        Parameters:
        msg - String containing XML to be parsed.
        validating - True if the file should be validated and XML schemas are not being used. When schemas are used for validation rather than DTD files, this parameter should always be set false. Schema validation is performed separately using a javax.xml.validation.Validator instance.
        namespaceAware - True if support is provided for XML name spaces.
        logger - Logger used for reporting XML parsing problems. If null it uses its own logger.
        Returns:
        Root element of the Document resulting from parsing the XML.
        Throws:
        Exception - If fatal exception during parsing.

                            boolean validating,

      • save

        public static void save(Document doc,
                        File f)
                 throws TransformerException,
                        IOException
        Saves the given document as an XML file.
        Parameters:
        doc - Document to save.
        f - File to save to.
        Throws:
        TransformerException - if there is a problem converting the document to XML.
        IOException - if the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, does not exist but cannot be created, or cannot be opened or written to for any other reason.

      • save

        public static void save(Node node,
                        OutputStream os)
                 throws TransformerException
        Saves the given DOM Node as XML to an output stream.

        Note that Document is a Node - so a whole Document can be saved using this method as well as individual Elements, etc.

        Note that the output stream is not closed.

        Parameters:
        node - DOM node to save.
        os - Output stream to write to.
        Throws:
        TransformerException - if there is a problem converting the node to XML.

      • setAttributesFromProperties

        public static void setAttributesFromProperties(Object obj,
                                               Element element)
                                        throws Exception
        If the given object has a setAttribute( String name, Object value ) method any Properties elements found in the given element are used to set the attributes of the given object.

        Does nothing if the object does not have the above setAttribute method.

        Parameters:
        obj - Object whose attributes may be set.
        element - XML element from which we want to extract Properties.
        Throws:
        Exception - if extractProperties called on the given element throws an exception.
